summary: This is a supplemental declaration by Russell Capone, Counsel to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the SDNY, filed in a FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times against the Federal Bureau of Prisons. The declaration details the legal basis for withholding certain BOP records related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death under FOIA Exemption 7(A), citing potential interference with the pending prosecutions of BOP staff (Noel) and inmate Tartaglione.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein had an apparent suicide attempt while incarcerated at the MCC. Psychological records and a lieutenant's log entry from this date are being withheld.

events.title: Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC. Records from August 9-10, 2019, including SHU rosters and BOP logs, are central to the investigation and are being withheld.

events.title: Filing of Supplemental Declaration
events.description: Russell Capone files this supplemental declaration in the FOIA case (The New York Times Company v. Federal Bureau of Prisons) to further support BOP's motion for summary judgment.

keyFacts: The BOP is withholding four categories of records related to Epstein's incarceration under FOIA Exemption 7(A): inmate count documents, staffing records, psychological records, and specific BOP logs from August 9-10, 2019.

Withholding is justified to prevent interference with the pending 'Noel' prosecution (likely against BOP staff) and the 'Tartaglione' prosecution, as premature disclosure could influence witness testimony and jury selection.
Specific records detail Epstein's apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and the circumstances of his death on August 9-10, 2019, including SHU occupant details and staff rounds.

The declaration cites extensive media coverage and public speculation about Epstein's death as a heightened risk factor that could prejudice potential jurors if records are released prematurely or without full context.
